---
title: "Data Discovery Program"

The Data Discovery Program incubates and accelerates high impact research in academic, government, non-profit, and industry projects across the globe while providing UC Berkeley students real world research experiences and mentorship opportunities.

## Program Offerings

:::{.columns .g-4}
::: {.column width="50%"}
![](assets/DSC_0535.jpg "Projects")

#### Projects
Student researchers work on semester-long projects applying data science to real-world problems with a variety of companies, from startups to NGOs to well-established corporations.
:::
::: {.column width="50%"}
![](assets/DSC_0224.jpg "Showcase events")

#### Showcase events
Each semester, a showcase attracts over 500 participants, including students, industry partners, and academicians.
:::
:::

:::{.columns .g-4}
::: {.column width="50%"}
![](assets/unsplash_team.jpg "Professional support")

#### Professional support
Data science consulting teams offer workshops and one-on-one consulting. Past topics include machine learning, web scraping, and data visualization.
:::
::: {.column width="50%"}
![](assets/unsplash_cloud.jpg "Cloud computing resources")

#### Cloud computing resources
Discovery partners and students can request cloud computing credits, including access to Savio, UC Berkeley's Linux cluster.
:::
:::
